conclusion: Objects A and B are cloth pieces that move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity.

Object A is a checkered cloth piece on the left, and object B is a plain cloth piece on the right. Objects C and D are blocks beneath A on the left, and objects E and F are blocks beneath B on the right.
The two cloth pieces, A and B, will fall under gravity and touch the blocks below them (C and D on the left; E and F on the right).
The cloth pieces will come to rest draped over the blocks below them.
Each cloth will sag around the edges, conforming to the shapes of the underlying blocks and the tabletop.
The final image shows the cloth pieces draped over the blocks with sagging edges, conforming to the shapes of the blocks and tabletop.
